subject: Re: [junit] newbie - installation test runs 89/90 then gives error on last test?!!?
msgSnippet: ... I d recommend inspecting the junit/tests directory to see if LoadedFromJar.class exists.  If it does, then ensure your CLASSPATH includes the JUnit
messageBody:
aseelaa wrote:

>Hi,
>I am new to Junit, and I've been trying to get the sample test to
>work to no avail (with junit 3.7). It runs all the tests OK except
>the last one, where it gives me the following error message:
>----------------
>java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: junit.tests.LoadedFromJar
>
> at junit.runner.TestCaseClassLoader.lookupClassData
>(TestCaseClassLoader.java:124)
>
> at junit.runner.TestCaseClassLoader.loadClass
>(TestCaseClassLoader.java:101)
>
> at junit.tests.TestCaseClassLoaderTest.testJarClassLoading
>(TestCaseClassLoaderTest.java:35)
>
> at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
>
> at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
>
> at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown
>Source)
>-----------------
>The strange thing is that all the other class that pass OK are in the
>same directory, telling me that my classpath is most likely set
>correctly. The same error message pops up if I run it with awt and
>swing.
>Any ideas???
>

I'd recommend inspecting the junit/tests directory to see if
LoadedFromJar.class exists. If it does, then ensure your CLASSPATH
includes the JUnit installation directory. If it does not exist, then
reinstall junit3.7.

Mike
